intro: Acosta pseudomaculosa, commonly known as the spotted acosta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spotted leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and can reach heights of up to two meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
